pullrequest.title: Added wedge-juggler, schaal-juggler, and passive-dynamic-walker models

content.raw:
File organization notes: To keep the convention of gazebo_models and gazebo, the .world files should go in gazebo/worlds and the plugin files should be renamed to the class name of the plugin and put in gazebo/plugins.

Your helper data structures (Counter, Param, WorldParams, etc.) should probably also go in gazebo/plugins, although you might want to make a subfolder for them. At first glance, I noticed that wedge-juggler/WorldParams and passive-dynamic-walker/WorldParams are the same, and schaal-juggler/WorldParams is very close to the other WorldParams file. It would be good to clean up these redundancies and change the plugins to reference the same WorldParams file (same goes for Param.h and Counter.h).
content.html:
File organization notes: To keep the convention of gazebo_models and gazebo, the .world files should go in gazebo/worlds and the plugin files should be renamed to the class name of the plugin and put in gazebo/plugins.

Your helper data structures (Counter, Param, WorldParams, etc.) should probably also go in gazebo/plugins, although you might want to make a subfolder for them. At first glance, I noticed that wedge-juggler/WorldParams and passive-dynamic-walker/WorldParams are the same, and schaal-juggler/WorldParams is very close to the other WorldParams file. It would be good to clean up these redundancies and change the plugins to reference the same WorldParams file (same goes for Param.h and Counter.h).

pullrequest.title: Added wedge-juggler, schaal-juggler, and passive-dynamic-walker models

content.raw: When I followed the instructions in README.md for the passive dynamic walker, the world loaded in Gazebo but the walker did not appear because the model was not found. I renamed the model to "passive-dynamic-walker" here and in the .world file, and it worked. I believe the name of the model has to match the folder name for Gazebo to find the model.
content.html: When I followed the instructions in README.md for the passive dynamic walker, the world loaded in Gazebo but the walker did not appear because the model was not found. I renamed the model to "passive-dynamic-walker" here and in the .world file, and it worked. I believe the name of the model has to match the folder name for Gazebo to find the model.

content.raw:
after
~~~
export GAZEBO_PLUGIN_PATH=${GAZEBO_PLUGIN_PATH}:[where the libwalker.so is]
~~~

following works for me:
~~~
diff -r d04b714b4233 passive-dynamic-walker/model.sdf
--- a/passive-dynamic-walker/model.sdf	Wed Oct 08 18:52:25 2014 +0000
+++ b/passive-dynamic-walker/model.sdf	Mon Oct 27 15:23:01 2014 -0700
@@ -815,7 +815,7 @@
     </joint>
 
 
-    <plugin name="walker-plugin" filename="/home/drum/.gazebo/models/walker/debug/libwalker.so" /> 
+    <plugin name="walker-plugin" filename="libwalker.so" /> 
   </model>
 </sdf>
~~~
content.html:
after

export GAZEBO_PLUGIN_PATH=${GAZEBO_PLUGIN_PATH}:[where the libwalker.so is]

following works for me:

diff -r d04b714b4233 passive-dynamic-walker/model.sdf
--- a/passive-dynamic-walker/model.sdf  Wed Oct 08 18:52:25 2014 +0000
+++ b/passive-dynamic-walker/model.sdf  Mon Oct 27 15:23:01 2014 -0700
@@ -815,7 +815,7 @@
     </joint>


-    <plugin name="walker-plugin" filename="/home/drum/.gazebo/models/walker/debug/libwalker.so" /> 
+    <plugin name="walker-plugin" filename="libwalker.so" /> 
   </model>
 </sdf>

content.raw:
I get the following warning when I run cmake on this project:

"This command specifies the relative path

    BULLET_LIBRARIES

  as a link directory.

  Policy CMP0015 is not set: link_directories() treats paths relative to the
  source dir.  Run "cmake --help-policy CMP0015" for policy details.  Use the
  cmake_policy command to set the policy and suppress this warning."

This may be related to why I can't compile schaal_juggler--compiler can't find btBulletDynamicsCommon.h. Anyone else running into this problem on a clean build? I'm trying to figure out if it's a problem with my setup (gazebo compiled from source on default branch, Bullet 2.82 installed from debs on trusty).

pullrequest.title: Added wedge-juggler, schaal-juggler, and passive-dynamic-walker models

content.raw:
I think the search plugins could be cleaned up/generalized a bit.

One thing I find odd is that the class contained in the plugin for a particular model and the class for its corresponding search plugin have the same name and share some of the same code (the onUpdate function for the controller is basically a subset of the search plugin, for example) but fulfill different functions... I wonder if the search functionality should be contained in the same class as the controller but could be toggled with a command line argument. Also, then the user could run the result of the search in simulation without restarting Gazebo, and the maintainers of this project wouldn't have to worry about twice as many model plugins.

The other thing is that the search functions share a lot of code between them--their function names are all the same, and their set_param and get_param functions are very similar. I think these could be abstracted into a "SearchPlugin" class, and the search functionality would then inherit from that class.
content.html:
I think the search plugins could be cleaned up/generalized a bit.

One thing I find odd is that the class contained in the plugin for a particular model and the class for its corresponding search plugin have the same name and share some of the same code (the onUpdate function for the controller is basically a subset of the search plugin, for example) but fulfill different functions... I wonder if the search functionality should be contained in the same class as the controller but could be toggled with a command line argument. Also, then the user could run the result of the search in simulation without restarting Gazebo, and the maintainers of this project wouldn't have to worry about twice as many model plugins.

The other thing is that the search functions share a lot of code between them--their function names are all the same, and their set_param and get_param functions are very similar. I think these could be abstracted into a "SearchPlugin" class, and the search functionality would then inherit from that class.

pullrequest.title: Added wedge-juggler, schaal-juggler, and passive-dynamic-walker models

content.raw:
I have a custom install of bullet 2.83, and needed to adjust cmake for the schaal-juggler to make things compile:

~~~
diff -r d04b714b4233 schaal-juggler/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/schaal-juggler/CMakeLists.txt	Wed Oct 08 18:52:25 2014 +0000
+++ b/schaal-juggler/CMakeLists.txt	Mon Oct 27 14:45:12 2014 -0700
@@ -12,12 +12,29 @@
 link_directories(${GAZEBO_LIBRARY_DIRS})
 
 # attempt to find bullet
-find_package (Bullet)
+# find_package (Bullet)
+#################################################
+# Find bullet
+# First and preferred option is to look for bullet standard pkgconfig,
+# so check it first. if it is not present, check for the OSRF
+# custom bullet2.82.pc file
+pkg_check_modules(BULLET bullet>=2.82)
+if (NOT BULLET_FOUND)
+   pkg_check_modules(BULLET bullet2.82>=2.82)
+endif()
+
 if (BULLET_FOUND)
+  set (HAVE_BULLET TRUE)
   add_definitions (-DHAVE_BULLET)
-  include_directories (BULLET_INCLUDE_DIRS)
-  link_directories (BULLET_LIBRARIES)
-endif (BULLET_FOUND)
+  add_definitions( -DLIBBULLET_VERSION=${BULLET_VERSION} )
+  include_directories(${BULLET_INCLUDE_DIRS})
+  link_directories(${BULLET_LIBRARY_DIRS})
+  add_definitions(${BULLET_CFLAGS})
+else()
+  set (HAVE_BULLET FALSE)
+  add_definitions( -DLIBBULLET_VERSION=0.0 )
+  BUILD_WARNING ("Bullet > 2.82 not found, for bullet physics engine option, please install libbullet2.82-dev.")
+endif()
 
 add_library(juggler SHARED controller.cpp WorldParams.cpp)
 target_link_libraries(juggler ${GAZEBO_LIBRARIES} ${Boost_LIBRARIES})
~~~
content.html:
I have a custom install of bullet 2.83, and needed to adjust cmake for the schaal-juggler to make things compile:

diff -r d04b714b4233 schaal-juggler/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/schaal-juggler/CMakeLists.txt Wed Oct 08 18:52:25 2014 +0000
+++ b/schaal-juggler/CMakeLists.txt Mon Oct 27 14:45:12 2014 -0700
@@ -12,12 +12,29 @@
 link_directories(${GAZEBO_LIBRARY_DIRS})

 # attempt to find bullet
-find_package (Bullet)
+# find_package (Bullet)
+#################################################
+# Find bullet
+# First and preferred option is to look for bullet standard pkgconfig,
+# so check it first. if it is not present, check for the OSRF
+# custom bullet2.82.pc file
+pkg_check_modules(BULLET bullet>=2.82)
+if (NOT BULLET_FOUND)
+   pkg_check_modules(BULLET bullet2.82>=2.82)
+endif()
+
 if (BULLET_FOUND)
+  set (HAVE_BULLET TRUE)
   add_definitions (-DHAVE_BULLET)
-  include_directories (BULLET_INCLUDE_DIRS)
-  link_directories (BULLET_LIBRARIES)
-endif (BULLET_FOUND)
+  add_definitions( -DLIBBULLET_VERSION=${BULLET_VERSION} )
+  include_directories(${BULLET_INCLUDE_DIRS})
+  link_directories(${BULLET_LIBRARY_DIRS})
+  add_definitions(${BULLET_CFLAGS})
+else()
+  set (HAVE_BULLET FALSE)
+  add_definitions( -DLIBBULLET_VERSION=0.0 )
+  BUILD_WARNING ("Bullet > 2.82 not found, for bullet physics engine option, please install libbullet2.82-dev.")
+endif()

 add_library(juggler SHARED controller.cpp WorldParams.cpp)
 target_link_libraries(juggler ${GAZEBO_LIBRARIES} ${Boost_LIBRARIES})

pullrequest.title: Added wedge-juggler, schaal-juggler, and passive-dynamic-walker models

content.raw:
Just to double check naming convention, should we replace hyphens ("`-`") with underscores ("`_`") so to stay consistent with existing models?
Also, minor suggestion here, recommending putting `juggler` at the beginning of the name, easier for tab-completion when looking for `juggler`s...

e.g.

 * `passive-dynamic-walker` becomes `passive_dyanmic_walker`
 * `schaal-juggler` becomes `juggler_schaal`
 * `wedge-juggler` becomes `juggler_wedge`
content.html:
Just to double check naming convention, should we replace hyphens ("-") with underscores ("_") so to stay consistent with existing models? Also, minor suggestion here, recommending putting juggler at the beginning of the name, easier for tab-completion when looking for jugglers...

e.g.

  • passive-dynamic-walker becomes passive_dyanmic_walker
  • schaal-juggler becomes juggler_schaal
  • wedge-juggler becomes juggler_wedge

benefits of using it...
